Name: Statue of the Wife of Metri
Description: Metri was a chief royal scribe during the Fifth Dynasty. Metri's wife, the owner of this statue, was a priestess of the goddess Hathor. Her statue is made of one piece of painted wood. She is portrayed standing and wearing a long tripartite wig and a long, tight dress. The legs and feet are in poor condition. Her neck is adorned with the large Usekh collar and two bracelets are on her arms.
